NATO allies yield to Trump's demands, pledging 3.5% of GDPs to military spending
description: At the summit in The Hague, the US achieved what it had come for: a commitment by Europeans and Canadians to increase their military spending. While Donald Trump did not challenge the allied solidarity of Article 5, he secured a minimalist final declaration.

description: Relations between Marine Le Pen and Jordan Bardella, leaders of the far-right Rassemblement National party, have grown strained since May, as speculation that Bardella might run for president in 2027 gains traction.

headline: Japan is questioning its alliance with Donald Trump's United States
description: Faced with Trump's unpredictable policies, Japanese leaders are considering the need to develop an alternative diplomatic and security strategy to reduce their dependence on the US.

headline: China has enlisted star influencers to boost its global image
description: Taiwanese and US influencers share their China trips on social media, seemingly wowed by everything. A state-run media outlet even offers all-expenses-paid trips to influencers with more than 300,000 followers.

headline: 'Dating apps have every interest to turn our love lives into gruy√®re cheese, full of holes and short-lived misfires'
description: In an interview with Le Monde, Arnaud Poissonnier, author of a book examining the love industry, advocates for regulating the sector through a professional association and calls on platforms to 'completely rethink their systems.'

description: Israel's recent military offensives in Gaza, the West Bank, Lebanon and, together with the US, in Iran, will fuel hatred of the West and a desire for revenge across the Middle East, writes Robert Malley, the lead negotiator of the 2015 Iranian nuclear deal.

headline: Paris men's fashion week: Saint Laurent and Louis Vuitton unveil vibrant, colorful shows
description: For the men's spring-summer 2026 collections, presented in Paris through June 29, Anthony Vaccarello blended powerful silhouettes and bold hues for Saint Laurent, while Pharrell Williams drew on motifs of elephants, giraffes and zebras inspired by India for Louis Vuitton.

headline: 'How far should one go to accommodate Trump, who makes no secret of his disdain for Europeans?'
description: From flattery to concessions, every detail was arranged to minimize the risk of a diplomatic incident at the NATO summit in The Hague. It is time to change tactics, argues Le Monde columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.
